div1.p: Kent provides the dates of Walter Reed's attendance at the University of Virginia, as well as other biographical references.

UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA, January 27, 1905.
Dear Dr. Kelley:-
div1.p:
Our records show that Mr. Walter Reed entered the
University at the beginning of session 1867-8, and during that
year pursued Academic courses in Latin, Greek, History and Litera-
ture; the next year, 1868-9, he succeeded in completing the entire
Medical Course as then mapped out, and received his degree of
Doctor of Medicine.

A biographical sketch of Dr. Walter Reed appeared
in the Virginia Medical Semi-Monthly for January 1903. This mag-
azine is published in Richmond, Va., and its Editor is Dr. L. B.
Edwards. Another article appeared in our University of Virginia
Magazine, written by Dr. Peete. This I shall try to find for you,
and send under separate cover if I can procure it.

I am very glad that you are writing a life of Dr.
Reed, of whom the University is very proud. He is the son, as you
know, of an old Methodist minister, and his brother is now the ef-
ficient presiding elder of one of the Virginia circuits.

With very best wishes for you personally, and pleas-
ant recollections of your visit, which I hope you will repeat at
your earliest convenience, I am,
div1.closer:
Very truly, Charles W. Kent W. J. D.
Dr. Howard A. Kelly,
#1418 Eutaw Place,
Baltimore, Md.
